definition: to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)
the Goldbach conjecture in number theory
pinyin: Ge1 de2 ba1 he4 cai1 xiang3

sentences.english: A conjecture of super-universality of the dynamical critical exponent Z is presented.
sentences.chinese: 提出了一个关于临界动力学指数Z的超普适性猜想。

sentences.english: Supposedly, the fabled perfection of art began by mirroring the faultless beauty of nature.
sentences.chinese: 我们猜想，艺术虚构的完美是对无暇的自然美的反映。

sentences.english: So what would you guess about these aberrant AOL users?
sentences.chinese: 这么一来，你会怎么猜想这些畸形的美国在线用户？

sentences.english: Now as you might guess, This can make gas hydrate kind of hard for miners to handle.
sentences.chinese: 你应该已经猜想到这会使矿工们很难处理它们。

sentences.english: I guess all of us would agree that we can never have enough massaging gadgets.
sentences.chinese: 我猜想我们都认同现在的按摩工具功能都不够齐全。

sentences.english: Now he and a colleague have proven it using rigorous mathematical arguments.
sentences.chinese: 现在他和他的同事用严谨的数学论据去证明这一猜想。

sentences.english: SHAKIR:Does man think that We shall not gather his bones?
sentences.chinese: 难道人猜想我绝不能集合他的骸骨吗？

sentences.english: The cold smile on his face made me guess that he considered himself to be superior to others.
sentences.chinese: 从他脸上的冷笑我猜想到他自以为高人一等。

sentences.english: I guess I approached it with the end in mind.
sentences.chinese: 我猜想我在接近目标过的程中心里总是想着它。
所以我猜想，笑是可以传染的。

sentences.english: The team suspects that another 18 species might be discovered.
sentences.chinese: 该勘察小组猜想还能再发现18个新物种。

sentences.english: What some people call presumption or fanaticism , I call solidity of purpose.
sentences.chinese: 被有些人称作猜想或是盲信的，我称之为坚定的信念。

sentences.english: I wonder if China or America will win most medals.
sentences.chinese: 我在猜想是中国还是美国会夺得最多的金牌。

sentences.english: This is your first visit to the Fair, I presume.
sentences.chinese: 我猜想，这是您头一次参观这个交易会。

sentences.english: Harry supposed that the wind must have caught him in mid- jump.
sentences.chinese: 哈利猜想大概是风半路上把他托上去了。

sentences.english: I began to think that this small-brained thing might be a very early whale.
sentences.chinese: 我猜想那个小脑动物很可能就是早期鲸。

definition: conclusion/verdict/CL:個|个[ge4]/to conclude/to reach a verdict
to conclude/to determine/to come to a judgment
to doubt (sth)/to be skeptical of/to have one's doubts/to harbor suspicions/to suspect that
to imagine/to assume/to envisage/tentative plan/to have consideration for
to be convinced/to be sure/to firmly believe/to be positive that/definite news
